The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are glossy and often have a slight pubescence, while the stems are woody and can become quite branched over time. Coprosma × kirkii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and ability to form dense thickets.
